sub_topic: Finding the area of a trapezoid.
message_1: A trapezoid has a height of 7 cm and its two parallel bases have lengths of 12 cm and 18 cm, respectively. What is the area of the trapezoid?
message_2:
To find the area of a trapezoid, we use the formula:

Area = (1/2) * (sum of the lengths of the parallel bases) * height

In this case, the height is 7 cm, and the lengths of the parallel bases are 12 cm and 18 cm. So, we plug these values into the formula:

Area = (1/2) * (12 + 18) * 7

Area = (1/2) * (30) * 7

Area = 15 * 7

Area = 105 cmÂ²

The area of the trapezoid is 105 square centimeters.
